p: The regimens for prophylaxis of GvHD based on rabbit anti-human thymocyte immunoglobin (ATG 10 mg/kg, Thymoglobin®, Genzyme Polyclonals S.A.S) effectively prevented the occurrence of grade II-IV aGvHD with incidences of 33.4−46%, grade III-IV aGvHD 12−14.9%, but the reactivation incidences of cytomegalovirus (CMV) and EB virus (EBV) were higher due to a slower immune reconstitution [ 2− 4]. The 100-day CIs of CMV and EBV viremia were 61−64% [ 2, 5] and over 50% [ 5, 6], respectively. Although ATG-based regimens have achieved excellent results, the incidences of aGvHD and the posttransplant virus reactivation are still higher, affecting the long-term survival of the patients.
